clipboardHistory.value:
# Power menu controls lock, suspend, relaunch, restart, shutdown
bind = SUPER, ESCAPE, exec, ~/.local/share/omarchy/bin/omarchy-power-menu
bind = SUPER, space, exec, pkill wofi || wofi --show drun --sort-order=alphabetical --style="$HOME/.local/share/omarchy/default/wofi/search.css"
waybar uses a config.jsonc config file.. can I include files, essentially I want to put modules in a separate folder and not all in the config file itself
1Password for Linux now marks values copied out of the app as sensitive for clipboard daemons and managers.

input {
  # Use multiple keyboard layouts and switch between them with Alt + Space
  kb_layout = de
  # kb_options = compose:caps,grp:alt_space_toggle
  kb_options = ctrl:nocaps
  repeat_rate = 40
  repeat_delay = 600


  # Increase sensitity for mouse/trackpack (default: 0)
  # sensitivity = 0.35

  touchpad {
    # Use natural (inverse) scrolling
    natural_scroll = true

    # Use two-finger clicks for right-click instead of lower-right corner
    clickfinger_behavior = true
    tap-to-click=false

    # Control the speed of your scrolling
    scroll_factor = 0.4
  }
}

device {
  name = glove80-keyboard
  kb_layout = us
  kb_variant = intl
}

If anyone's using the same monitor for multiple machines, you can make a keybinding using ddcutil (`pacman -S ddcutil`) to switch inputs on your monitor. I have it set up as this for a Dell monitor:
```
bindl = SUPER ALT, Home, exec, ddcutil setvcp 60 0x11 # HDMI-1
bindl = SUPER ALT, End, exec, ddcutil setvcp 60 0x1b # USBC
```
"bindl" ensures that it will work even when the lockscreen is enabled
bind = SUPER, space, exec, pkill wofi || wofi --show drun --sort-order=alphabetical

Download your preferred flavor from themes/ to your Rofi configuration directory.
Import the palette file at the top of your Rofi configuration file. For example, @import "catppuccin-mocha".
Instead of making a custom configuration, you may want to simply use the default Rofi theme with the Catppuccin palette; download catppuccin-default.rasi (in addition to your preferred flavor file) to your Rofi configuration directory, and set it as your theme in the main Rofi configuration file with @theme "catppuccin-default".

The Wayland (layer shell) support added in this fork has now been merged in Rofi mainline. We will soon archive this repository after the next release of Rofi ðŸŽ‰!

Until then, you should already fill Wayland-related issues and PR to the main Rofi project and follow its guidelines.

Thanks to all contributors and Rofi enjoyers!

windowrule = float, class:^(com.clipboard.Clipse)$
windowrule = size 622 652, class:^(com.clipboard.Clipse)$

indowrule = float, class:^(com.clipboard.Clipse)$
windowrule = size 622 652, class:^(com.clipboard.Clipse)$
The class name must follow the requirements defined in the GTK documentation.

The setting that will change the application class value.

This controls the class field of the WM_CLASS X11 property (when running under X11), and the Wayland application ID (when running under Wayland).

Note that changing this value between invocations will create new, separate instances, of Ghostty when running with gtk-single-instance=true. See that option for more details.

The class name must follow the requirements defined in the GTK documentation.

The default is com.mitchellh.ghostty.

This only affects GTK builds.

windowrule = float, class:^(clipse)$
windowrule = size 622 652, class:^(clipse)$

# Float in the middle for clipse clipboard manager
windowrule = float, class:^(clipse)
windowrule = size 622 652, class:^(clipse)
windowrule = stayfocused, class:^(clipse)
